alert.note: Alert for Clay; Cumberland; Fentress; Jackson; Overton; Putnam (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 26 at 12:28AM CDT until June 26 at 1:15AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Overton County in Middle Tennessee... Northern Cumberland County in Middle Tennessee... Jackson County in Middle Tennessee... Southwestern Clay County in Middle Tennessee... Putnam County in Middle Tennessee... Southern Fentress County in Middle Tennessee... * Until 115 AM CDT. * At 1227 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles east of Celina to 7 miles south of Mount Pisgah to Huntsville, moving southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Cookeville, Livingston, Gainesboro, Fairfield Glade, Algood, Monterey, Baxter, Allardt, Grimsley, Whitleyville, Rickman, Clarkrange, Crawford, Granville, Cummins Falls State Park and Standing Stone State Park. This includes Interstate 40 near mile marker 268, and between mile markers 277 and 308. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Cumberland; Fentress; Jackson; Overton; Putnam
